website_summaries.verdict: If you take your ironing seriously, and are no stranger to the ironing board, you need an iron that works as hard as you do to remove wrinkles and creases from your clothing. The SteamForce is up to the task, with the highest level of steam production of all Rowenta irons.
pros: Stainless steel soleplate glides smoothly over all types of fabric
400 microholes, 1800 watts of power, and 220 g/min of steam production make quick work of ironing
One-touch control for choosing fabric setting
Produces 30% more steam than other irons
cons: Iron is much heavier than some would like

customer_reviews.title: Gotta say for the price I’m disappointed. The steam is nice
customer_reviews.text: The handle and temperature change dial need to be in separate areas on the iron. Every time I pick up the iron my knuckles inadvertently changes the temp to a lower setting. The iron spat water on my garments and I followed instructions. Our water isn’t hard here either. Gotta say for the price I’m disappointed. The steam is nice. I debated getting another but the handle design is ridiculous and not thought out very well. You have to relearn how to hold an iron to avoid changing the temp. Not sure I can get another with the handle issue. I have medium size hands for a guy. They aren’t big.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Iron does not last - look for another brand
customer_reviews.text: The iron worked great... for a while. Biggest annoyance is that its very easy to change the heat setting (its on a dial below the handle) while you are ironing. Unfortunately after about a year it started falling apart. The spring loaded water door fell off and just last week the steam switch fell into the body of the iron when I switched the setting. I would expect for from Rowena - especially at that price. I will be contacting Amazon and Rowena to see what they will do to make this right. This is not the first Rowenta iron that’s disappointed but it will be the last.
customer_reviews.author: SDVA

customer_reviews.title: Steam flap quit working. Would not recocommend
customer_reviews.text: This iron did not hold up to the ironing I have to do for my husbands shorts, pants and shirts. The steam lever stopped working and I had to buy another iron. I purchased this iron 12-11-17 $113.36. I am extremely unsatisfied, the heat at 1800 watts is weak & the steamer stopped working in less than 1 yr. Unfortunately, return date expired with Amazon. It is not easy to clean. I do not recommend this iron, especially for this price.
customer_reviews.author: Old Woman

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly awesome - when it isn't leaking live a sieve
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly awesome - when it isn't leaking live a sieve. Bought this as a replacement for an earlier model Rowenta which was having severe leakage problems. This one performed well for about 9 months, and then the leaking began. Sent it in for warranty repair in February 2017. Now two months after receiving it back (with zero indication of what work they did on it BTW) it now leaks worse than it did when it was sent in. Totally unacceptable and completely overwhelms all of the great features that it does possess.
customer_reviews.author: M J Peters

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed the temperature control fell off in my hand .Had problems even getting someone to answer there 800 number when I finally did they gave me a place to send it in for warranty work got it back the temperature worked a lot smoother until you want to put it on lowest setting it won't go or the knob gets stuck.now the extra burst of steam don't work properly or don't work most of the time.worst iron I have ever had and i'm a long time Rowenta iron user because of the burst of steam but not worth the money junk iron .They may of lost my .I have only had it about 5 months .
customer_reviews.author: Jane Wyczalek

customer_reviews.title: PROCEED WITH CAUTION
customer_reviews.text: I have had this iron for six and a half years. All this time it worked mostly fine, with a few small hiccups. After that, the iron literally went down with a blast. I plugged it in and suddenly all of the modes on the display lit up. Something loudly exploded inside the iron. It severely short circuited, caught on fire, and almost burned the house down. Glad that I have ceramic floors where I usually used it. So, while it works, it works fine. When it stops working, you better be careful, or you might lose your house in a fire. Unsafe appliance, to put it mildly. Expected better safety from Rowenta.
customer_reviews.author: K. Gray

customer_reviews.title: Caveat Emptor!
customer_reviews.text: Caveat Emptor! I saw the other poor reviews but thought there was no way "Rowena" could produce such a poorly made iron - thats what they are known for! I unpackaged and it started out great. Incredible steam - 90 minutes after shutting it off from its first use though, the machine started making loud "clicking" noise. I used it a second time and again the clicking noise kicks in a while after proper shut down that does not stop. Do a search and you will find many instances of this problem. My wife and I cannot leave it plugged in. So 24 hours after receiving, we are sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: ATH in Mass

customer_reviews.title: Product has gone downhill
customer_reviews.text: I used to buy this iron because it was such high quality but not anymore in my opinion. Read the poor reviews some people were giving and I ignored them. I ended up with the exact same problems. Two major ones. As my wife and I say it just pees on things. You feel it with water and it leaks out. The second is it won't turn off when you stop using it. It just keeps clicking on and off. Sent it back and got a new one and it peed and clicks on and off too. I read that the French brought the German company out so maybe that explains what happened.
customer_reviews.author: LadyE

customer_reviews.title: Broken upon arrival and used already
customer_reviews.text: I received my iron yesterday evening after I got home from work how excited 😊 was I because I wanted it for Black Friday but Macy had it for 104.00 dollars so I look 👀 on amazon and it was a lot cheaper almost 30.00 savings well this morning I unboxed my iron happy to iron my work clothes with it until I noticed the plate was scratched up and the lights were on with no heat WTF type of games are yawl playing at Amazon out of all my years I have never witnessed such a disappointment 🤬
customer_reviews.author: Lovely Girl 6

customer_reviews.title: My old cheap $20 iron never leaked..I would expect that from a chip $20.00 Chines products... but not from a $100 German Iron...
customer_reviews.text: I got this Iron 3 days ago... What a junk! out of the box it was defective... Emptied the water tank reservoir overnight (damaged the Ironing board and the carpet under the board) I would expect that from a chip $20.00 Chines products... but not from a $100 German Iron... My old cheap $20 iron never leaked and still works fine..., when I called Rowenta customer service I got a very disappointing response of we can replace it in 3-6 weeks if you send it back. Forget about this Iron its no good... and customer service is no better because it costs more...
customer_reviews.author: Omid

customer_reviews.title: A good iron but need to be careful about the water & maintenance
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made iron and works very well. However, you have to be diligent with the water and cleaning. The instructions say not to use distilled water and that tap water is best. I bought this exact model a year ago, used tap water, and rarely used the self-clean function. it clogged up and began leaking. No amount of self-cleaning would fix it at that point. So I bought another one. This time I am using spring water only and the self-clean function every week. Hopefully, this one will last. if not, I'm done with Rowenta irons.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Rogler Lord

customer_reviews.title: I am so disappointed with this ROWENTA DW9280 Steam Force 1800-Watt that I ...
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed with this ROWENTA DW9280 Steam Force 1800-Watt that I purchased 2/2015 because it stopped working. My previous one I purchased lasted over 9 years, which made me confident in upgrading to this model. At first it was love at first sight with the bright blue and shiny chrome, until the honeymoon ended and this baby quit on me while I was ironing. I called AMAZON and they sent me a return label, but I will not receive another only my money back, to bad. When it was good (working) it was great, but now, I just have to wait. Will keep you posted on the final outcome, not a happy camper ; (
customer_reviews.author: HidefinishonNYC

customer_reviews.title: Hard Pass.
customer_reviews.text: Crapped out after less than 7 months of light to medium use. The pump for the steam function has started making a lovely grinding noise, it spits like a wet cat, and the self clean function does exactly nothing to protect against the formation of rust. I cannot believe that an iron this expensive is this poorly made. I wish I had hunted more diligently for another delonghi I only replaced my old one because I literally dropped it on a tile floor and it started to leak. It gets one additional star for the weight, which is heavy; and the warm up time, which is quick.
customer_reviews.author: Walruswalrus

customer_reviews.title: Hot Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I bought this iron in December2019. By the end of February, it was making a loud noise when plugged up, a loud hum that just didnt sound right. Any water poured into the iron for steam purposes would make its way through the holes on the iron's flat surface and all over the clothing being ironed. By the first week of March, the steam button wouldnt come back up after being pressed. By then, it was too late to return it. Either I was sent a defective iron, or the quality truly is what I've experienced...I may never know. In both cases, I lose. A $10 iron would have lasted longer than this very expensive piece of hot garbage!
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: I right very few review. I know this is known name in the Iron. But I would say its wrongly advertised that it anti dipping. After a use of 2 months its starts dipping water like hell. As you turn Iron on cloths it will drip 15 to 25 ml of water. Spoiling all the cloths. Contacted Amazon supports team they said they can not do any this as its old than 30 days. Not whole stories starts with manufacturer and you all know how manufacturer works. Please read reviews properly before buying this item..
customer_reviews.author: Priya Rana

customer_reviews.title: They are the best for quilters
customer_reviews.text: Dear Rowenta, after many irons from you in Germany leaking I gave up but other brands aren’t as amazing as you are so I am reuniting. I always miss the rowenta pointy tip when I “give up” on the brand because of leaks. I quilt quite a bit and my iron is nearly as important as my sewing machine. I wish irons lasted as long as sewing machines! I recently had another brand of iron leak and came back to rowenta. I couldn’t stop reading the glowing reviews on this one! This time I will drain the water compartment after each use and clean you regularly and take advantage of the Amazon extended warranty if you leak.
customer_reviews.author: Karen P

customer_reviews.title: TREAT YOURSELF TO A NEW IRONING EXPERIENCE!
customer_reviews.text: If you do any amount of ironing, this is definitely the iron to have! I am 72 years old and have worked with many irons in my life and I never knew that ironing could be such a breeze! I was a little concerned about the price. I thought I had bought "top of the line" irons in the past...but the Rowenta was such an amazing experience it just blew all the others right out of the water...and well worth it's price! Treat yourself to a totally new ironing experience!
customer_reviews.author: ADK-JAH

customer_reviews.title: Second hand product
customer_reviews.text: This product was in the original box, but definitely had been repackaged. Possibly, someone returned the iron and the vendor resold it. I considered returning it, but decided to test it out. The iron works very well, so I kept it. For me, the price was a sacrifice for something I've wanted for a very long time. Receiving it would have been more emotionally rewarding had it not appeared that somebody else previously purchased and returned it. The iron is heavy and not as simple as a $20 iron you pickup at Walmart. It is good for someone who sews a lot and needs more precision, dependability, and durability. Beautiful iron that works well for a seamstress.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed! It worked WONDERFULLY the first month or so
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed! It worked WONDERFULLY the first month or so. Gets nice and hot. Put out copious steam. Shirts looked professionally done! Now, however, the steam output is almost nonexistent. It does a fair job of ironing. I paid WAY TOO MUCH for an iron that only worked about 6 weeks. My previous iron was a Rowenta which lasted at least 10 years, and worked well the entire time. It never did iron like this new one did AT FIRST, but was ok. I was expecting to be much happier with this one!
customer_reviews.author: kansas nurse

customer_reviews.title: DW9280-LEAKER
customer_reviews.text: If only it worked as I would have liked. It leaks too much, I'll be sending this one back, this is the only fault I have found. I really like this iron, it's my third Rowenta iron in five years. DW5080 broken line cord, that I've fixed myself, then the water inlet door broke off, so I got the DW6080, but... It just stoped working, no power, so I got this DW9280. It only lasted two weeks, they need to do better. I purchased extended warranty, but I didn't receive it yet, where can I get the others repaired? I'm in Brooklyn N.Y. Help ! I'm very frustrated at this time.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Made in Germany-works as good as it sounds
customer_reviews.text: I was in the Marine Corps, and worked in a recruiting station for 18 months. I would iron my uniforms, which included 3 back creases, and 2 in the front on my shirts. I wish I had this baby back then, in the late sixties. This is a beauty. If you have a need and can spare the cost, but this, you will not regret your purchase. Take a moment to read the instructions, follow them, and this iron will last you awhile. Made in Germany, works as good as it sounds. I know there are negative reviews, but also know this one works well for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon CustomerJim

customer_reviews.title: Rowenta Steamforce, DW9280
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used Rowenta Irons since the 1990’s. Each lasting me a good 5 years. Finally had to get a new one. The Rowenta Steamforce DW9280 is by far the worst iron I’ve ever owned. After having it just 2 days the steam blast button quit working, so it was replaced with the same make and model. 6 weeks in the same thing occurred with the replacement iron. I work mostly with fine Pima cottons, I need steam. Now I cannot get a hold of any customer service to see what can be done. I have never had a Rowenta Iron that wasn’t perfect. Obviously, they don’t make them like they use to. Am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: jruleman

customer_reviews.title: I want to love this iron, I can’t...
customer_reviews.text: It leaks. It leaks and leaks some more. Sigh. I’ve had this iron for over a year and I love everything about it but it leaks every time I use it. I iron 5-6 times a week and at first the leaking started after about 5-7 minutes and now almost instantly. It’s ridiculous for what is purported to be the best iron out there. Mine does say “Made in germany” but still, quite mediocre for such an expensive iron to have such flaws. I love it when it works, love the steam and the weight doesn’t bother me, but leaking all over my clothes is just not cool.
customer_reviews.author: Tia

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this LEAKER!!!
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT buy a Rowenta! I had this iron for 10 months and it started to leak. I shipped it off for repair, and it was returned in working order after two weeks. The repair lasted for 13 months and, again, it will not hold water. The entire tank of water leaked out. Rowenta will not repair be because it is out of warranty. When you spend this much on a professional iron there is an expectation Rowenta does not meet. This was my 3rd and last Rowenta. They all leaked around a year of use.
customer_reviews.author: Luther C. Wike

customer_reviews.title: produces better steam, and your clothing looks like you picked ...
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding results. Steaming is industrial grade. 4 stars for constantly hitting the temp dial with my knuckle and ergonomics. I'm constantly having to reset the temp. I also have the Panasonic which came in 2nd place on CR to this iron. The Panasonic shines in ergonomics, but the Rowenta destroys the Panasonic when it comes to ironing and the end result. It's faster, gets hotter, produces better steam, and your clothing looks like you picked it up from the cleaners. The Panasonic is more nimble, lighter and does a good job. The Rowenta does an outstanding job and the results are as close to professional as I've seen from a household iron.
customer_reviews.author: Sloan Ranger

customer_reviews.title: Great Iron!
customer_reviews.text: I have had several Rowenta irons in the past (we iron daily) and have been pleased with their irons. No, they haven't lasted more than several years a piece, but with the amount of use, I think that is to be expected. This iron is a little bigger and heavier than my previous irons, but I got used to it very quickly and it does a great job of getting the wrinkles out. It produces a lot of steam and I am very pleased with its performance.
customer_reviews.author: poohbear

customer_reviews.title: Packaging insufficient
customer_reviews.text: The iron is great - it does have a bit of a buzzing sound, but we will see if it continues. The box was just the thin carboard box that you would buy it in the store (not corrugated and no styrofoam-hence the lower rating). Thisis an expensive, and heavy item that will shift around in the box. It is fortunate that it was not damaged. The box was crunched a bit, but the iron seems to be okay. It is larger than my last Rowenta, so it will take some getting used to.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Keene

customer_reviews.title: Is there such a thing as calcium free iron?
customer_reviews.text: I really like this iron. It heats sup fast, large water capacity, accurate temp sensor. I've been using it for about six months now and it's performing really well still. Starting to get calcium build up even though we "purge" it about once a week. The gunk still comes out onto the clothes so I have to be careful when ironing dark clothing. The heat plate is starting to get some rust looking build up but it has not affected the performance. I think it will last and has done really well thus far. I do recommend as I don't think there is such a thing as build up free iron unless you're religious about only using distilled water...not me.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Chamorro

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Steam in this iron.
customer_reviews.text: I love this iron because it gives off lots of steam and heats up very quickly with no leaking at all. I love the blue color but because it's so dark, it's difficult to see how much water is in the iron. It has automatic turn off and never gets hot, however, it makes a clicking sound that makes me nervous so I plug it when I'm not using it. All in all, it does what it is supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy G

customer_reviews.title: Leaks like a sieve
customer_reviews.text: I loved this iron the first 3-4 months before water started running out of the bottom of the iron, soaking my ironing surface and my projects. I am a quilter and sometimes need lots of steam, which this iron provides. It gets extremely hot, which is also a good thing. It is very heavy, which is good, but causes fatigue for my arthritic hands. I'm giving up on this expensive iron and will start using my old dry iron that gets very hot, is light, and never drips! Guess its back to the 50's for me.
customer_reviews.author: Forward Thinker

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed. At a lose.
customer_reviews.text: If this manufacturer ever had a good reputation for building quality beyond the normal iron producers; I scream out, “THEY DONT BUILD EM LIKE THEY USE TO!!!” I’ve had my iron 16 months and the last two months have been trying. Regularly it would not produce steam, outside of burst. The water fill spout is poorly designed in a way that allows water to escape during ironing. Lastly, the finally was the moment the fabric selector got stuck and eventually CAME OFF!!
customer_reviews.author: Ramone Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great Iron - Had to Exchange The First One
customer_reviews.text: This iron works great. It creates massive amounts of steam. I had to exchange the first one that I received because it was making a loud clicking noise when the iron was off. Others mentioned this same problem and I was afraid that the second iron would make the same noise but it doesn't. If you get one that makes that clicking noise, don't let them tell you that it's normal. Exchange it for a new one. The exchange process was super easy and fast. Love this iron.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Rowenta you disappoint me.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this on July 23, 2017. I'm a quilter and mostly use it for that purpose. It is now just over 1 year old and water is pouring out of the bottom when I have it sitting upright. This just started happening, until now it's been a dream. Other people have told me that theirs leaked and they won't buy Rowenta anymore. I figured they must have had the Made in China version because my Made in Germany version worked fine. Well, now that it's leaking, more like pouring. I did a search online and found out that MANY of them leak after 1 year. Come on Rowenta, you let me down.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Another Rowenta iron heading for the trash !
customer_reviews.text: Just started leaking a few days ago. Never been dropped or used by anyone else. Rowenta's customer service number is shut down (they site Covid 19 as the reason) and their online customer form malfunctions with an error message (with no logical explanation). Done buying Rowenta!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother
customer_reviews.text: I iron a lot and enjoy the steam this iron produces to ease the chore. This iron usually lasts me about two years before I need to replace it. I bought this iron as the back up to one that was beginning to fail and began to use it about a month ago. The steam button has already failed and the plug has signs of melting near one of the prongs. I am past the return window because I have been storing this iron prior to beginning to use it. An expensive disappointment. Rowenta, it's time to move on.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne Charlat

customer_reviews.title: I can't stop ironing - it's that amazing!
customer_reviews.text: There are two types of people in this world - those who iron - and those who walk through life as wrinkled schlubs. Trust me when I say that this iron will make both types happy. The weight is perfect in my hand. The heat and steam make children's play out of ironing my linen clothes. FINALLY - my comforter cover looks "store new" after I wash and iron it. If you subscribe to consumer reports, they rated this as one of their top irons. Users gave it poor ratings - said lots of leaks. I personally have not had that experience. Honestly the best iron I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: vlvo544grl

customer_reviews.title: Broke in 3 months of light use, terrible customer service.
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this iron for me for Christmas, and it stopped working in April after only very moderate use. He tried to reach them about getting it replaced, but did not get a response until July, when we were told they’d give us the name of a place where it might be able to be repaired at our expense. This is supposed to be a high quality product, but I’ve had better customer service for $10 products. I loved my previous Rowenta, which I had for years before it died, but I won’t buy another. I suggest you steer clear as well.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Y Brown

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic iron
customer_reviews.text: Terrific iron. I had been using a 12-year-old cheapo iron that had been broken for ages (the sprayer didn't work, the steamer didn't work, it would automatically shut itself off every few minutes), thinking "well, it still gets hot--that's all that matters, right?". Wrong. I finally bought this iron and WOW...what a world of difference. It's heavy enough that it actually presses--you know, like it's supposed to--and the steam feature is the best I've ever used. I can make short work of ironing now with this baby. SO glad I got this.
customer_reviews.author: BeautyAdornsVirtue

customer_reviews.title: LEAKS: Really?
customer_reviews.text: Have purchased many irons, and should have just bought a less expensive iron from Walmart or other bargain store. This unit actually leaks while ironing making a mess, but it does have a nice color of blue. We should have returned the iron, but got busy going past the return day period. Personally, do not see the advantage of this iron at all except it does auto shut off and what irons don't do that?
customer_reviews.author: Thelma

customer_reviews.title: Love ❤ my iron highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: IRON 3 TIMES A WEEK DEF NEEDED A GOOD IRON AND GLAD I GOT THIS ONE. IRON MY UNIFORMS AND WHEN I GO OUT MY GOING OUT CLOTHES. HAVENT TRIED IT ON AMYTHING ELSE BUT CLOTHES BUT I LOVE MY IRON. YES ON THE HIGHER PRICE BUT I WANTED AN IRON THAT WILL LAST ME A LONG TIME SINCE I USE IT VERY OFTEN... HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT! ALSO USE IT ACCORDINGLY. I READ SOME COMPLAINTS IN THE REVIEWS BUT THOSE ARE FIXES THAT GET DONE IF YOU USE IT ACCORDINGLY...
customer_reviews.author: Erick MnM

customer_reviews.title: Would buy it again
customer_reviews.text: I love this iron! I made a Quilts on a daily basis, and use the iron on a daily basis. I have gone through several other brands, and within a few months they have stopped steaming. This one, however, God is still working great. I love all the steam vents! The only problem I have had with this iron is that it cannot be filled to the “Max“ line. If I do so, it tends to spit and sputter. So, I don’t feel that that full! It is a little heavier than previous irons, but using it to press seams on quilts, the extra weight is a boon.
customer_reviews.author: JLGL

customer_reviews.title: Died
customer_reviews.text: Bought this February 2020 then it died September 2020. It won't go past the lowest setting or it just shuts off right away. So disappointed. Now I have to pay to ship this "heavy" iron to a repair shop or drive 45 min plus to take it there. The repair tech said there won't be a charge if it's fixable. Oh, and it will take a couple of weeks to find out. I don't have a backup iron. Not acceptable for a $100 iron.
customer_reviews.author: KimMart

customer_reviews.title: Broken in less than 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on April 15 and noticed that the button to push for the steam iron would periodically stick. Didn’t think too much about it other than it being an inconvenience. Today (July 9) It is permanently closed and I can’t use the steam feature anymore. The window to return was May 31 so I’m stuck with a $90 iron that is absolutely useless since I use steam all the time when sewing. I’ve had many Rowentas over the years, and knew to make sure it was made in Germany instead of China. This will be the last Rowenta I will buy.
customer_reviews.author: Fl girl

customer_reviews.title: Awful performance and a purchase rip-off
customer_reviews.text: With so much hyperbole about this iron, I expected professional and ease-of-use but received none. This may be because I purchased a refurbished product which I will never do again. This iron produces little steam and does not rid wrinkles. When I use the force steam feature, which I have to use in order to get rid of wrinkles on cotton fabrics, it locks down, sticks, and will not work during the remaining ironing cycle and sometimes during the next cycle. Being new to ironing, I assumed that this was normal behavior until I used a cheap steam light weight iron which performed superior to this one while staying at a hotel recently.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell Harris

customer_reviews.title: Heats up in less than a minute and the steam feature is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I used to despise ironing...until I got this monster of an iron. It tackles everything in my wardrobe and then some. The steam feature works very well and I can usually crank out 8-10 pieces of clothing before having to refill it. Rowenta has been making irons for ages and it shows. This unit heats up fast and is ready for use in less than a minute! The faceplate is massive and knocks out wrinkles quickly and without a fuss. I even liked the self-cleaning feature. It was easy to perform which means this iron will be around for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon Ewasiuk

customer_reviews.title: Best Iron I’ve Ever Owned
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of sewing and therefore use my iron a lot, too. I replaced my old Rowenta iron with this model and the difference is night and day. It seems this Rowenta iron does twice the job in half the time. I agree with other reviewers that it uses quite a bit of water, but it also delivers incredible steam and makes my sewing projects much easier. I’ve been sewing face masks so I’m using it all day, every day and am continually impressed with the performance of this Rowenta iron.
customer_reviews.author: J. Baur

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This is not made like the older versions of Rowenta. For the price, it should not have had the water closure break off in the first week. I bought it for my daughter, because I have an older model that works like a dream. When I used hers, it didn’t iron out wrinkles as quickly, the shape of it was of no advantage. I’d think they should quit trying to “improve” what used to be an excellent iron.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy

customer_reviews.title: Iron all the things!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The iron I’ve used for ~20 years finally gave out so I did a little research and bought this beauty as recommended by Consumer Reports. I am not disappointed at all!!!! In fact, I’m always excited to iron now! My old iron was great, but this one is amazing! Love the point to get into tight spots around buttons. The steam output is fantastic. Hiiiiiighly recommend this great iron!!
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: Too Heavy
customer_reviews.text: This iron is too heavy! And to be honest, it is not a lot better than my 8 year old ex Rowenta iron. I was expecting that they would delevelop better products in the last almost 10 years. So my old iron is way lighter and it has almost the same performance. They only made it more modern looking , but heavier. If you need to iron a few things once in a while, then you can get this (but then you can also get a cheaper design). If you need to iron more than a few pieces at a time, never get this unless you have strong muscles (add the water, it gets even heavier!!!).
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: NO, save your money!!! Not all that.
customer_reviews.text: I am a meticulous ironer so maybe it is me, or maybe I have always had great irons. This iron is NOT everything people are raving about. The only thing that I found phenomenal was the steam burst, otherwise it is like all the other irons that I have had. I will keep it, but I don't think it was worth the money. HYPE!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kelvin

customer_reviews.title: High Quality
customer_reviews.text: This iron is worth every cent you pay for it. This was a gift to my sister who has been a seamstress for years, but not by profession. She said she wishes she'd had this years ago, as it's the most fantastic iron she has ever used. I only buy Rowenta for myself, as well.
customer_reviews.author: Janice Bloomenrader

customer_reviews.title: Quilter's Best Friend???
customer_reviews.text: I have used and loved a Rowenta for nearly 20 years so ordered another without really looking into it. I find a lot to love about this new one but also am not pleased that the water level is so hard to see through the blue plastic. I am not 100% convinced this one is producing steam out of its 400 holes as I don't hear the familiar hiss as I pick it up from a place were I am ironing and I seem to work harder with this one than my other one to get out all the wrinkles in cotton fabrics - not good for a quilter like me!
customer_reviews.author: 41spots

customer_reviews.title: He said it's perfect for all his tailoring needs
customer_reviews.text: Update (6/22/2018): The steam pump button is no longer working properly. It doesn't depress right away and takes a few minutes before it gets back to its original position. Not expecting this since this iron is less than 2 months old. Everything else is still working. Bough this iron for my dad and he loves it. He's a tailor and use it every single day. He said it's perfect for all his tailoring needs.
customer_reviews.author: Giang VuTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Rowenta iron model a lemon
customer_reviews.text: This is the second iron of the same model I have received in a few weeks. The first iron buzzed loudly and smelled of burnt wiring. It was replaced by an identical model that buzzed loudly while sitting on his heel. I called the manufacturer for tech-support and they said that it does make that noise but to return it if I am uncomfortable with it. Our quilters group has this model and it doesn’t make any noise.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Weakley

customer_reviews.title: DID NOT MEET EXPECTATIONS
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I wanted a quality iron. I don't iron that often but when I do I want it to work. I went several months without ironing and when I started using the iron, gobs of white stuff are being exuded from the iron. It's also hard to see through the blue color to check whether water is in there, which was probably the problem. There should be much better information provided on use and maintenance so that the iron clearly states not to have any water in it during non-use. I feel completely ripped off. When I looked for repair option, the nearest dealer is 2 hours away. Not happening. I'd love a refund, please.
customer_reviews.author: tulip

customer_reviews.title: Simply steam, steam,steam!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have to say if anyone is looking for a high end wonderful iron, this is the iron for you. After purchasing recently two other mid priced Roweneta irons, and having to return them, both for leaking water I was a bit gun shy as to try again. But I thought, perhaps the third time will be the charm. BINGO, HOUSTON we have a winner!!!!!!! This iron is such a pleasure. I iron all of my sheets and 100% cotton clothing, and I sew. The steam output is amazing, consistent and ever flowing. No drips, just crisp clothes/sheets. Silly to say, but I can't wait for the next laundry day to do it all over again.
customer_reviews.author: Alan H

customer_reviews.title: Dies after little use
customer_reviews.text: Most expensive iron I have ever purchased. I iron mostly shirts and then maybe six or seven per month. The steam is actually too much as my shirts almost need to go back in the dryer after ironing. When I would raise it upright to rest it a huge gush of steam would about melt the paint on the wall. There is no way to gauge the amount of water you are putting into the iron or when it is getting low. I have had to throw it away after very little actually use as it just died on me.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne D. Merritt

customer_reviews.title: Leaking at First Use, Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: So dissapointed. I have been buying Rowenta irons for years. I been noticing a decline in their product. I use my iron almost daily, I'm that person that likes to iron. I just purchased Model DW9280, the same as my previous iron which just died after a few years of use. This morning I was excited to use my brand new iron but was so dissapointed that it was leaking all over my clothes. I read the instructions again and the "Problem" page. I did everything right. Will try again but I may have to return the iron.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Leaks like crazy
customer_reviews.text: I have had this iron for 4 months now and it leaks horribly. The water streams out and puddles at the bottom. The manufacturers warranty only covers repairs that take 2-3 weeks to complete, so you would have to go that long without an iron. Customer service was quite rude and told me that I would have to get put on queue to get called back in 24-48 hours. I would highly suggest not purchasing this iron.
customer_reviews.author: samie

customer_reviews.title: Best Iron I ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Who would think that an iron could be so exciting. Honestly I thought an iron is an iron. Why pay more than 20 bucks right? yeah... Well this iron works really well. And I can use tap water. It has this constant steam feature that irons so good... hard creases are literally erased. I never thought I'd own such a fancy iron.
customer_reviews.author: S. Cea

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.text: Mine stopped working today! I’m so disappointed now and I can’t return and it’s only been used maybe five times? I bought it for almost $90 in January 2020 And now it’s quit working — I’m very disappointed and it’s never really gotten my clothes crisp ironed :( but I kept thinking I would try it a few more times and then today it won’t even come on :( don’t buy!
customer_reviews.author: Jerri  Spinks

customer_reviews.title: Frustred with this iron
customer_reviews.text: My rowenta iron stuck and left residue on the iron had it on a cotton setting iron a shirt and it kept sticking nothing came with the iron. But directions it already is unable to clean the cup that you used to put water in was also gone I wanted the best is the reason I got this iron I paid 100 dollars you would think I would get better quality I called the company and they was not opened frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: Pamelia Carlisle

customer_reviews.title: Takes wrinkles out after first pass
customer_reviews.text: I love this iron. Yes, it’s a little heavy, but for a quality iron and if you don’t want to be constantly ironing the same area to get the wrinkles out, this is great! It heats quickly, but you must empty the water out of it after you use it so it doesn’t calcify. I have one blouse in particular that used to be awful to iron, now I’m done in no time with it. I love this iron.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy B Kime

customer_reviews.title: Great investment!
customer_reviews.text: This iron does a great deal of work! Wrinkles, creases, and crinkles are no match for this steam iron! Works great for ironing large scale fabrics like bed sheets, draperies, table cloth, etc. Highly recommend this item if you iron A LOT at home. The iron may seem a bit heavy at first use, but I've gotten use to the weight of it after many uses.
customer_reviews.author: L.C.

customer_reviews.title: V8 of irons
customer_reviews.text: This iron is very powerful. It's not light and it guzzles water like a V8 engine of a car would guzzle gas, but it's powerful and irons well, just like an iron should. My son even enjoys using it. I use this one for quilting, but my older Rowenta for ironing clothes. I'm thinking I need two of these though and retire my older Rowenta.
customer_reviews.author: ME

customer_reviews.title: lots of steam...hoping for longer reliability
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. The last Rowenta (Steamium 9081) lasted less than two years...stopped steaming despite lots of clean cycles). Consumers Report top rated it in November 2015 so keeping my fingers crossed that this one lasts longer. Puts out lots of steam so far. I like a heavy iron so this weight works. The blue colored fill indicator should be clear so you can better see the water level...some one else has commented on this. I am getting used to looking closely as to where the water line is.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It irons well, but...
customer_reviews.text: No matter if you turn it off yourself or it goes to auto-off, it will either flash a light nonstop or make clicking noises. Most times I just unplug it because it is SO ANNOYING. So the plugging in and out adds a step to the process. However, it functions very well as an iron.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. M

customer_reviews.title: Ours overheated, safety hazard
customer_reviews.text: We've had this iron for just over 1 year now. We use it very minimally as I get most of my dress shirts dry cleaned. Overall I would have given it 5 stars until it started overheating, smell of burnt plastic and smoke coming out and burning my shirt. I feel like this iron is a safety hazard. I'm afraid of plugging it back in to see if it still works. We haven't tried contacting rowenta. We will purchase a new iron from a different company not associated with Rowenta. Very unfortunate given the high price point of this iron... Better QA might have prevented this.
customer_reviews.author: JF L.

customer_reviews.title: Quality product!
customer_reviews.text: I’m very impressed with this iron. I bought my previous Rowenta iron more than a dozen years ago. Over the years the cord became defective so we bought this one. Wow! The illuminated fabric settings are very helpful in determining whether the appropriate temperature has been reached. The pointy end of the iron is more pronounced which makes it easier to be precise in ironing tight areas. It’s a heavier iron but in my opinion it makes it more effective. You know it used to be called “pressing “ clothes instead of “ironing” clothes. The weight contributes to its ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: 95437 shopper

customer_reviews.title: Pray that I can get a replacement!
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased this around the 8 August 2018. Not able to test it until 4 September 2018 because was on travel for work. When to put water in it today, 16 September 2018 and the flap where the water goes came completely off. Tried putting it back on and the little wire sprang popped off. I am so upset. Paid over $100 for this iron and it is already falling apart. It’s to late for me to send it back. I was so excited when I bought it...guess I should have done more research on this product and the company. Huge lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Crowvest

customer_reviews.title: If only it would weigh less and not leak it would be perfect
customer_reviews.text: Heavier than expected even though I read the reviews I’ve never owned an iron with this weight I wish I could give it 3 1/2 stars it doesn’t deserve four because it does leak water here and there but it’s not really a three because the quality of this is superb if only it would not leak and weigh less
customer_reviews.author: M&M

customer_reviews.title: Works Great until It Doesn't!
customer_reviews.text: I had this iron for nine months. It worked great during that time, but then the water from the steam container just spilled out of the iron making it useless. For six weeks now I have tried to contact the company since it is under warranty for a year. No one answers the phone and I have sent in several forms filled out and still do not get a response. I guess they are waiting for the warranty to run out. Way too much money for a product that is not used often and is now useless.
customer_reviews.author: Tine

customer_reviews.title: Horrible warranty service!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy this iron because if you have an issue with it Rowenta will not take care of you. Run quick and far away from this product.
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased almost $500 worth of rowenta irons in the last 2 years and have had nothing but problems! They all have stopped steaming! I just asked rowenta to replace the most recent one and they said no they will send me a prepaid shipping label to return it for repairs. Now I'm out an iron until it comes back.....
customer_reviews.author: Mike Hodgman

customer_reviews.title: Great performance, but started to leak just after 4 months of use. Ruined several shirts.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd Rowenta Iron. Replaced another Rowenta Iron (DW6080) I got back in 02/2016. Both worked great. This one, DW9280, performs amazing. Purchased 06/22/2019. But the the reason I'm writing this review is because it started leaking really bad. Messed up several shirts already with this brown gunk that it spits out the iron. I followed all the steps to keep it clean and do the self cleaning function as recommended by Rowenta. Now hoping their customer service team and warranty perform as well as the iron does when it was working good. I'll keep everyone updated.
customer_reviews.author: F. Guese

customer_reviews.title: very easy to accidently change the heat setting while ironing do ...
customer_reviews.text: very easy to accidently change the heat setting while ironing do to the position of the dial under the handle--- also the spring latch door over the water reservoir fell off after 4 months of very seldom use ---i tried to contact the company about this via e-mail 2 times and received no response i'd try a different brand---- but everything made today seems to be junk !!
customer_reviews.author: Susan J. Degrave

customer_reviews.title: Powerful steam iron
customer_reviews.text: I am a fan of Rowenta irons and this model, DW9280, is the best yet. The first item I tackled was a white cotton shirt that was very wrinkled from being at the bottom of the basket for a while. One swipe over each area and the wrinkles were gone! I was very surprised. The steam is quite strong and works like magic. Ironing is incredibly easy and fast with this Rowenta. If you want power and ease, I highly recommend this to you.
customer_reviews.author: Arleen

customer_reviews.title: Great wrinkle disappearing iron!!
customer_reviews.text: I love rewenta irons! It's he only iron I've ever owned. This one is a bit awkward for me, because the spray button is under the handle and the steam button is on top of the handle. I wish it was switched around. And it's a bit heavy. But man does it get your wrinkles out! It's an awesome iron. I'm giving it 5 stars because of the steam feature but it is heavy iron with and without water in it. Think it will just take some time to get used to it since all my other rowenta iron have had the steam and spray buttons on top of the irons.
customer_reviews.author: David C

customer_reviews.title: You will get steam
customer_reviews.text: Very good at producing steam. Moderately heavy iron on the pricey side. Maybe not for those who like a lighter iron. If you do a lot of steam ironing you might prefer a steam station iron with larger water capacity. You will be filling this one frequently which wasn't a bother for me. The only real gripe is the temp setting wheel is too large and is easily bumped when grabbing the handle which changes the irons temp. I see other reviews mention this issue also. This could easily be a problem if ironing delicate fabrics with lower heat setting and inadvertently changed to high. This was more of a concern for me than running out of water too frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Experience
customer_reviews.text: I owned a Rowenta iron for 15-20 years that worked beautifully until recently. I purchased this new model at a premium price because of German manufacturing and previous experience with the brand. I used the iron maybe 6-12 times before it stopped working completely. I followed all directions regarding use and care. Even prior to breakdown, the heating was uneven and general erratic performance. What a disappointment -- and a hassle. Warranty repair involves shipping away for 2-4 weeks. Meanwhile, no iron...
customer_reviews.author: John L. Hildreth

customer_reviews.title: This model disfunctions within 3 months of use
customer_reviews.text: I use this for basic home ironing. It’s my second one in a year. It starts leaking eventually. Also after 3 months of use the steam button just gets stuck and it can’t be used. This is a bad model iron. Trust me. Between my 3 homes I’ve had numerous Rowenta irons.
customer_reviews.author: R.  Shiffer

customer_reviews.title: Produces great heat and steam
customer_reviews.text: I'm a quilter and it is absolutely necessary for me to have an iron that can keep up with my demand for heat and steam to press my seams. I've used Rowenta irons for years but it was time for me to replace my old steam generator. This was the perfect choice. Although it has an automatic shut-off feature, it quickly heats back up with steam which is a great feature for me since I tend to press my pieces in groups rather than all at once. I've tried other brands based on others feedback, but I always come back to Rowenta.
customer_reviews.author: Dena Martin

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE...!!!!  FRUSTRATING...!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 months ago and now that it's not returnable this iron is having major issues and ready to throw it across the room...!! It shuts off after I iron one side of the shirt and pick the iron up vertically....shut off to the point where I can virtuall touch the soleplate within 5 seconds, then have to turn the temp down then immediately up in order for it to rest to the correct temp. Frustrating to wait another 30 plus seconds fro it to reach proper temp...and then the leaking!! SOOOO frustrated...! This is the 3rd Rowenta...NEVER AGAIN!!!!
customer_reviews.author: sk

customer_reviews.title: Failed in less than a year!
customer_reviews.text: Initially I liked the iron though it was pricey. Yes, it used alot of water & the dark blue body & water tank is a poor idea as it's difficult to determine the water level. However, it did what it was supposed to do, get really hot & create great steam. But, that did not last long. One year since purchase & the steam button stopped working months ago, it leaks & the heat is inconsistent. I find myself in need of a new iron. I will certainly not repurchase a Rowenta!
customer_reviews.author: Journey

customer_reviews.title: This Iron leaks like crazy
customer_reviews.text: I used this iron right out of the box and was impressed with its substantial sturdiness, but after using it only once, was very disappointed with what appears to be a faulty water reservoir system inside the iron. It dripped water was I used it, and when I unplugged it and set it down overnight in the upright position as directed in the manual, I came back to see the ironing board literally soaked with water from it. It was in the correct position all night for storage. I moved the iron for the picture so one could see the extent of the leakage. Too bad...this iron could have lasted years and looked otherwise to be a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Dulberg

customer_reviews.title: My last Rowenta was 25 years old, the new one is a step above
customer_reviews.text: Rowenta is a great brand. I had my old one since my wedding 25 years ago. The new one has a differently pointed ironing surface at the tip that gets in the creases more easily. It also has an amazing 'poof' of steam when you press a button that knocks the old one out of the water thereby removing the wrinkles. It is much better looking than the old one and glides better. I am enjoying the upgrades but would not have needed a new iron unless I had broken the old one by dropping it on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline W.

customer_reviews.title: No steam
customer_reviews.text: First use, no steam. Bought this to replace exact same model that began over-heating and burning fabric. This one produces no steam unless you press for a shot of steam. Not user error; I'm quite familiar with this iron. They are great when they work. Too bad quality control didn't catch this before it was packaged. I'm afraid I have to be done with Rowenta.
customer_reviews.author: R. Spies

customer_reviews.title: Noisiest Iron EVER
customer_reviews.text: When this iron is in use or plugged in it makes a loud buzzing sound that gets on your nerves very quickly. I am a quilter so I have the iron on/plugged in when I am quilting and the noise is so loud that I can hear it over my sewing machine. HATE it and it drives me crazy. If you can tolerate the noise it is a great iron. I gave it two stars because it does a great job. The noise it makes took it down to a one star for me.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa L

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the pricetag.
customer_reviews.text: I've been ironing since I was in high school so I've been through many irons. I thought that I would be getting a better quality and more functional product by going with a high priced Rowenta. However, I have not found that it works any better then the last $30 iron I owned. It makes plenty of noise from the internal pump. The water fill cover fell off and the spring shot off and disappeared. Now the steam button sticks. I've only owned it a few months and already more problems than I ever had with my old iron after 4 years. I recommend buying something more reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley O.

customer_reviews.title: Sharp creases, plenty of steam, professional results
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using Rowenta irons for many years. My clothes come out looking professionally done. My husband’s uniforms always have sharp creases where they need to be. Leaking has been the reason I have replaced each one of my previously own Rowenta irons. I checked reviews on many other irons and they eventually leak too.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Gallo

customer_reviews.title: This Leaks!
customer_reviews.text: Less than a year old and it leaks terribly. I expect more from Rowenta and for $100 iron it should last more than a year. I have discussed this with Rowenta and now they are sending it out for repairs and it will be gone at least 3 weeks. Very inconvenient since I am in the middle of making a quilt for my daughters wedding next month!
customer_reviews.author: RDB

customer_reviews.title: A splendid iron
customer_reviews.text: No one really likes to iron, but this iron makes it almost fun. One pass and it's done, no matter how wrinkled it started out. Cotton napkins? Done. Flat and smooth. Shirts? You can press both sides of the sleeve at once. Steam? Swoosh! Heats up fast. Fills easily. If it's a little hard to see the full level, but once you run over you'll never overfill again.
customer_reviews.author: Prof

customer_reviews.title: does not shut down like conventional irons
customer_reviews.text: although the heat shuts down, the ON LIGHT stays on forever!!!!!!! i called the manufacturer, and was advised that this is the way it is. i do not like seeing a blinking red light at all times (especially from the corner of my bedroom area when it is otherwise totally dark at night). so you actually need to unplug the iron!!!!! now i have to debate whether to return it. ALSO,,,,,,,,it is very, very heavy compared to other irons.
customer_reviews.author: m

customer_reviews.title: GreatIron
customer_reviews.text: I have had several irons over the past 6 years, and Donne can compare to this sone. It does what it should, doesn’t leak, doesn’t cut off to soon, but yet it cuts off after 30 seconds if left in the ironing position. The last one I had would cut off after 90 seconds if you left it sit on its butt. That is just to quick of a turnoff if you are quilting, or even ironing laundry. This one hold more water, and the burst of steam is impressive. German engineering!
customer_reviews.author: Dr.Bonnie Serrett

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have no complaints I’ve had this over a year now and now writing the review I would buy again
customer_reviews.author: melinda wilson

customer_reviews.title: Don't do it!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have not had this iron you a year and it's done! The steam button is broken. If the iron is sitting up it will come out and when I want to iron it falls into the iron. So no extra steam for me. It will leak out water....but no steam. NOT HAPPY AT ALL. It didn't even last a year. At that price I feel robbed.
customer_reviews.author: Nisa

customer_reviews.title: Mine was Defective
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this iron as opposed to a cheaper iron because i wanted a GREAT iron. Unfortunately I had nothing but problems with mine right out of the box. Rowenta stood behind their warranty and "fixed" it but when I got it back, it still wasn't working right. They offered to fix it again but I was tired of messing with it. A brand new iron, and especially one that is this expensive should not have had to be sent in twice right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Megankay_28

customer_reviews.title: Not what they used to be
customer_reviews.text: Built cheaply compared to the previous irons from Rowenta. This iron was a replacement for one that leaked almost immediately when started using. Not a cheap iron! I have used Rowenta for a long time, but I am looking for another brand that is not as cheaply built
customer_reviews.author: SHEILA BUCHANAN

customer_reviews.title: Iron won't work!
customer_reviews.text: We have been in the process of moving so I have just now turned on my iron that I received on Aug. 5, 2019. I didn't anticipate any problems because it's my fifth Rowenta iron. I tired to turn it on and I can't make it work. I've watched videos and it won't heat up. So, do I just get stuck with a brand new iron that doesn't work?
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Knox

customer_reviews.title: Porsche of irons.  German quality
customer_reviews.text: Best iron I have ever had. I love using lots of steam when I iron and this things puts out tons of steam plus you can use regular tap water which it recommends. It has an anti calcium deposit feature and the LED window makes it easy to read what adjustment for what type of fabric you are using. If you like to iron and are particular about getting rid of the wrinkles then I would highly recommend this iron. Germans build Porsches and this iron is the Porsche of irons.
customer_reviews.author: OZ

product_meta.title: Rowenta DW9280 Digital Display Steam Iron, Stainless Steel Soleplate, 1800-Watt, 400-Hole, Blue
product_meta.description: Style Name:1800-Watt with Digital Display| Design:Steam IronFor powerful steam and professional-quality results, turn to the Rowenta DW9280 SteamForce steam iron. The handheld iron’s integrated electronic steam pump delivers a substantial burst of vertical steam (up to 210g) and pushes up to 30% more steam into material (compared to steam irons with no pump), ensuring fast, effective removal of wrinkles from all types of fabrics. A handy LED digital display illuminates for linen, cotton, wool, silk, or nylon to indicate when the soleplate has reached the appropriate temperature for the selected fabric. The iron’s Microsteam stainless-steel soleplate provides 400 steam holes for even steam distribution and includes an ultra-thin silicate coating for scratch-resistant strength and nonstick gliding to protect even the most delicate of fabrics. A smart steam motion sensor turns off variable steam when the iron stops moving, conserving water and electricity. Even more, the iron’s precision tip makes easy work of maneuvering over collars, along seams, and in between buttons, and the precision-shot function allows for a concentrated shot of steam at the top of the soleplate tip. For safety and peace of mind, the iron shuts off automatically after 8 minutes if left unused in the upright position and after 30 seconds if tipped over or left in the horizontal position. Other highlights include one-touch controls, a cool spray mist for extra-stubborn wrinkles, an integrated anti-calcium system, and a self-clean system for long-lasting performance. From household linens to personal wardrobes, make a good impression with help from the Rowenta SteamForce steam iron. The anti-drip system helps prevent spitting and leaking when thermostat is on a low setting.
feature_bullets: 1800 WATTS OF POWER TO CLEAN THE WHOLE HOUSE - Iron out the wrinkles and refresh not only any type of clothing, but also other house hold garments like curtains and blankets
POWERFUL BURST OF STEAM (210G) - Smothes out even the worst wrinkles on thick garments such as suits or curtains with up to 30% more steam than irons without pump technology
400 STEAMHOLES AND STAINLESS STEEL SOLEPLATE - Even steam distribution and smooth gliding across different garments for years to come. Power cord length - 2.5 meter

SAFETY COMES FIRST WITH ROWENTA – To prevent any sort of accident, this iron comes with a 3-way automatic shut-off system after being left untouched for 8 minutes vertically, 30 seconds face down or on its side
EASY TO USE- LED ready indicator; smart steam motion sensor; 3-way auto safety shut-off; anti-calcium and self-clean systems; large 350 ml water tank, smart steam motion sensor

MADE IN GERMANY – Expect only the best with German made irons and Rowenta. This iron is built to last with features such as a stainless-steel soleplate, anti-calcium system to use any water, and auto-cleaning system

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars6,679 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
